intro: Ammannia vescicatoria, commonly known as the prickly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant pink or red flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Ammannia vescicatoria is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
